definition: to establish/to found/to create (a good environment)
to begin/to initiate/to inaugurate/to start/to create
to set up/to arrange/to establish/to found/to display
design of a learning environment for young children, incorporating artwork designed to appeal to them/abbr. to 環創|环创[huan2 chuang4]

sentences.english: Therefore, the process of interaction in the classroom to create space, to give enough time.
sentences.chinese: 因此，在課堂互動過程中要創設空間，要給足時間。

sentences.english: Our company was established in 1950 by Mr.
sentences.chinese: 本公司是葉寬明先生於1950年創設的。

sentences.english: Zheng Xiyu and her colleagues have created a low-carbon working environment.
sentences.chinese: 鄭希瑜和同事們已經創設出一種低碳的工作氛圍。

sentences.english: It will create over 1million job opportunities.
sentences.chinese: 它將創設出上百萬個就業機遇。

sentences.english: Thus, we must create some conditions to help individuals seek and live a better life.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須注意創設條件，引導人追求且過上美好生活。
創設一種令人輕鬆的環境。

sentences.english: Creating a first-class school characteristics is our common wish.
sentences.chinese: 創設一流特色學校是我們共同的心願。

sentences.english: Creating manipulation surrounding will make study more interesting;
sentences.chinese: 創設操作情境，形成樂趣，變苦學爲樂學。

sentences.english: They are going to build a park equipped with a playground, ball fields and a museum.
sentences.chinese: 他們籌辦創設一個設有遊戲場，球場和博物館的公園。

sentences.english: Legislation is the formulation of law by the Queen in Parliament.
sentences.chinese: 立法是君臨議會系統創設法律的方式。

sentences.english: Theory of situated cognition insist set up students-centered learning environment.
sentences.chinese: 情境認知理論強調創設以學生爲中心的學習環境。

sentences.english: What's difficult to do in books for children is to create funny incidents.
sentences.chinese: 爲孩子寫書的難點在於創設有趣的環節。

sentences.english: Only by drawing boundaries and creating separate spaces is it possible to do this.
sentences.chinese: 只有畫地爲牢和創設分隔的空間才使得它變爲可能。

sentences.english: What better way to build positivity at work?
sentences.chinese: 還有什麼更好的在工作中創設積極情緒的方法嗎？

definition: faultless/complete/perfect/to leave nothing to be desired
to open/to start (a business etc)/to set up
to introduce into/to channel/to lead/to guide into/to import (data)
to push (for acceptance of a plan)/to push forward/to promote/to actuate/CL:個|个[ge4]
to confer/to discuss/to engage in talks
